text: I need to find my missing piece.
♪ And be more than a mystery ♪

You are not getting
passed me again.

- Ah!
- Shrimpy's ruining the dance,
but he's got some good moves.
( grunting )
That Shrimpy's slippery.

Maybe skelly man
could help us.
Okay, skelly man is alive now.

Oh! Everything he
touched is moving.

So he's got the power to bring
things to life. Awesome.

That's okay. My dance could
still be the best dance ever.
I can handle this.

Are you going to write about it
in your locked diary,

then bury the key so
no one ever finds it?

Actually, I was just going
to take that shrimp down.
That's a good plan, too.

Down, Shrimpy.
Good, Shrimpy

No more being a monster,
Shrimpy.
Can you sit?
No! Not punch!
Sit! Sit.

Okay, that's kind of
like sitting.
Should we try shake, instead?

I hope Addison
stopped that thing.
Ah, doesn't sound like she did.

No, skelly, we talked about
this. You stay here.

See, kids? This is why
you never run off by yourself

when horror movie
stuff is going on.

- There you go.
- Oh, thank you, Zed.

Shrimpy's on a rampage
and now the whole town is--
Definitely in danger. Not good.

- And the power plant!
- Not the power plant.

He might make it
to the power plant!
Yup. Real bad.
Really, really bad.

Like chocolate popcorn
fur balls in your cheese, bad.

Addison, come on. You have
to figure out what to do.

Hey, you don't have
to do anything,

because we can get through this.
Together.

You're right, Zed. Of course,
we can do this together.

- We're wolves!
- We're not wolves.
I don't know about this.

No, we're not wolves,
but just go with it.
♪ We own the night ♪
♪ Oh, we own what we own ♪
♪ Oh, we own the night ♪
♪ Oh, we own what we own ♪
♪ We own the night ♪

♪ The only thing that is worse
than our bark's our bite ♪
♪ Oh we own what we own ♪
♪ We own the night ♪

- ( howling )
- Whoo-hoo!

- Yeah!
- People are here, already?

They are really
on time for this dance.
It's an Addison special.

Of course people
are on time to see it.

Aww. We've got to catch
ourselves a shrimp!

All of Seabrook might be about
to get totally shrimped.

No! And since we're locked out
of the Fall Ball,

no one's going to get to see
my sweet new dance move.
Double no!
